intro: Serratula flavescens var. carthaginensis, commonly known as the Carthaginian yellow fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months, and its leaves are usually serrated, giving it its common name. This species is often found in areas with mild, temperate climates and is adapted to withstand periods of drought.
